page.title: 19SEALED KNOT SOCIETY
page.content: In 1968{Brigadier Peter Young}wrote a book about the battle of Edge Hill. This was published and printed by the {Roundwood Press,}then owned by Gordon Norwood. To launch the book "Edge Hill 1642" an exhibition was held at the Tower public house, Edge Hill, on the battle anniversary 23rd October. David Fisher and Gerard Lewis, both of Kineton,had assisted the Brigadier doing local research for his book and were put in charge of mounting the exhibition which was a great success. After discussion with Brigadier Young it was decided that his next book "Marston Moor 1644" should be launched with a group of people in seventeenth century military uniform. Stage by stage ideas were formulated to do this on a bigger and bigger scale. continued
